title: Al Kharrara
text:
Al Kharrara (; also spelled Al Harrarah) is a village in <a href="Qatar">Qatar</a>, located in the <a href="municipalities%20of%20Qatar">municipality</a> of <a href="Al%20Wakrah%20%28municipality%29">Al Wakrah</a>. The closest sizable city is <a href="Mesaieed">Mesaieed</a>, located to the east. It is a desert area, characterized by high aridity and the presence of grazing animals such as <a href="Dromedary">dromedary camels</a>, <a href="goat">goat</a>s and <a href="sheep">sheep</a>.
Etymology.
The village's name comes from the <a href="Arabic%20language">Arabic</a> "khar", which roughly means "the sound of running water". As the area consists of varying elevations and several hills, the process of <a href="surface%20runoff">surface runoff</a> is very noticeable during the wet months.
Geography.
Al Kharrara is situated in south-central Qatar. The villages of <a href="Al%20Aamriya">Al Aamriya</a> and <a href="Umm%20Hawta">Umm Hawta</a> in <a href="Al%20Rayyan">Al Rayyan</a> Municipality are nearby to the west.
History.
According to Richard H. Curtiss of the <a href="Washington%20Report%20on%20Middle%20East%20Affairs">Washington Report</a>, inscriptions dedicated to the pre-Islamic <a href="Nabataeans">Nabataean</a> god <a href="Manat%20%28goddess%29">Manāt</a> were found in Al Kharrara.
In <a href="John%20Gordon%20Lorimer%20%281870-1914%29">J.G. Lorimer</a>'s 1908 publication "<a href="Gazetteer%20of%20the%20Persian%20Gulf%2C%20Oman%20and%20Central%20Arabia">Gazetteer of the Persian Gulf</a>", he refers Al Kharrara as a <a href="Bedouin">Bedouin</a> outpost that lies "20 miles south of <a href="Doha">Doha</a>h and 6 from the east coast, between Naqiyān and Jabalat-at-Tuwar". He noted the presence of a masonry well, 27 fathoms deep, containing good water.
Industry.
The <a href="Qatar%20Primary%20Materials%20Company">Qatar Primary Materials Company</a> has centered its dune sand extraction operations here due to the area's relatively large deposits.
Sports.
The second stage of the Sealine Cross-Country Rally, which runs for 345.89 km, starts in Al Kharrara and ends in <a href="Mesaieed">Sealine Beach</a> (a section of Mesaieed).
